Let’s face it – nobody likes to clean. The quicker we can get it over with, the quicker we can get to the more important things in life. Here are a few tips for cleaning your home, inside and out, and a few ways to get the kids involved.
Beat the clock
1. Set a timer for 30 minutes and see how much you can get done in that time. You’ll be surprised how quickly you can work when you’re trying to beat the clock!
2. Kids can help by cleaning their room in record time. Give the child who wins a special treat at the end.
3. Start your cleaning by spraying your bathtub/shower, sink and toilet so you can let the cleaner soak in and scrub less later on. Pop two denture-cleaning tablets in the toilet for an hour or so to remove difficult stains.
4. Tackle one room at a time, dusting, then vacuuming and mopping. This way, you’ll avoid having to do anything twice and it’s easier to stay focused.
5. A mop often just spreads dirt around on your floors. For the quickest, most hygienic clean, the Kärcher steam cleaner and floor kit works wonders!
6. Save time going back and forth between rooms by wheeling the Tate laundry basket stand from room to room as you clean, using it as a place to put things that belong in other rooms until you get to tackling those rooms.
7. End your cleaning with a relaxing bath or shower. Just remember to bring a sponge and clean the inside while you’re at it.
Beat the clock
1. Set a timer for 30 minutes and see how much you can get done in that time. You’ll be surprised how quickly you can work when you’re trying to beat the clock!
2. Kids can help by cleaning their room in record time. Give the child who wins a special treat at the end.
3. Start your cleaning by spraying your bathtub/shower, sink and toilet so you can let the cleaner soak in and scrub less later on. Pop two denture-cleaning tablets in the toilet for an hour or so to remove difficult stains.
4. Tackle one room at a time, dusting, then vacuuming and mopping. This way, you’ll avoid having to do anything twice and it’s easier to stay focused.
5. A mop often just spreads dirt around on your floors. For the quickest, most hygienic clean, the Kärcher steam cleaner and floor kit works wonders!
6. Save time going back and forth between rooms by wheeling the Tate laundry basket stand from room to room as you clean, using it as a place to put things that belong in other rooms until you get to tackling those rooms.
7. End your cleaning with a relaxing bath or shower. Just remember to bring a sponge and clean the inside while you’re at it.
Dust in no time
8. Dust hard-to-reach spiderwebs and ceiling fans by attaching a towel to the head of your broom.
9. Use a coffee filter to gently dust computers and TVs in order to avoid scratching your screens.
10. Kids can help by dusting the blinds and baseboards with a sock puppet on each hand, ‘dusting’ the floor in fluffy socks and using a lint roller to clean scatter cushions and lampshades.
11. Use your vacuum cleaner to quickly remove dust from your curtains and couch. If you have a wet/dry vacuum cleaner like the Kärcher multipurpose vacuum cleaner, you can even remove stains by quickly rubbing a little soapy water on the stain before you vacuum.
Dust in no time
8. Dust hard-to-reach spiderwebs and ceiling fans by attaching a towel to the head of your broom.
9. Use a coffee filter to gently dust computers and TVs in order to avoid scratching your screens.
10. Kids can help by dusting the blinds and baseboards with a sock puppet on each hand, ‘dusting’ the floor in fluffy socks and using a lint roller to clean scatter cushions and lampshades.
11. Use your vacuum cleaner to quickly remove dust from your curtains and couch. If you have a wet/dry vacuum cleaner like the Kärcher multipurpose vacuum cleaner, you can even remove stains by quickly rubbing a little soapy water on the stain before you vacuum.
Make magic in the kitchen
12. To clean your microwave, just put half a glass of white vinegar in it on high for one minute and wipe away all the dirt along with the steam!
13. A dishwasher not only saves you time on the dishes but is also good for cleaning light fixtures, toys, caps, shoes, makeup brushes, kitchen sponges and more! Just remember to put plastic items on the top shelf, wash delicate items on a lower temperature and wash dishes separately from household goods. I’d recommend the Midea countertop dishwasher because of its compact size and energy efficiency.
14. Line your bin with newspaper before you put the bag in. It absorbs smells and liquid and is quick to replace. If you’re squeamish about touching your bin, get one with a foot pedal, like the Meliconi bins.
15. Cover your fridge shelves with clingwrap and your oven bottom with heavy-duty tin foil. Then you can just peel away the cover and replace it when things get messy.
Make magic in the kitchen
12. To clean your microwave, just put half a glass of white vinegar in it on high for one minute and wipe away all the dirt along with the steam!
13. A dishwasher not only saves you time on the dishes but is also good for cleaning light fixtures, toys, caps, shoes, makeup brushes, kitchen sponges and more! Just remember to put plastic items on the top shelf, wash delicate items on a lower temperature and wash dishes separately from household goods. I’d recommend the Midea countertop dishwasher because of its compact size and energy efficiency.
14. Line your bin with newspaper before you put the bag in. It absorbs smells and liquid and is quick to replace. If you’re squeamish about touching your bin, get one with a foot pedal, like the Meliconi bins.
15. Cover your fridge shelves with clingwrap and your oven bottom with heavy-duty tin foil. Then you can just peel away the cover and replace it when things get messy.
Spend less time on daily chores
16. Always have a designated place to put things you use often like your keys, shoes, jacket and handbag. This way, they’ll never lie around and clutter your home but will always be easy to find when you need them. See some smart storage options.
17. Kids can help by putting their dirty laundry and other things that need cleaning in the Ilana hanging laundry basket behind their bedroom doors.
18. Spend less time ironing by making sure your clothes don’t crease badly in the washing machine. Reduce the speed on your spin cycle, then shake out your clothes before hanging them on the line.
19. An even better way to cut your laundry time in half is by using a tumble dryer. It not only dries your clothes in record time but also effectively removes the creases from your clothes – which means less ironing!
20. Lastly, clean your car less often by protecting it inside and out. Put removable mats on the floor, seat covers on the upholstery and a car cover over the whole thing. All these are available in HomeChoice’s car accessories sets, with cleaning products for the rare occasions you actually need to wash your car.

All these are available in HomeChoice’s car accessories sets, with cleaning products for the rare occasions you actually need to wash your car.
I hope these tips have taught you some new tricks for speedy cleaning! Do you have any other great household hacks? Please feel free to share them with everyone on the HomeChoice Facebook page.
